attributes.action: I want dads to be able to see there child without a court order to do so.
attributes.additional_details: I speak for many dads that no dad nor mother should have to seek legal advice, pay a lot of money to see the baby or child they asked for it’s wrong that a parent withholds the children with absolutely no evidence backing up a good reason to do so.
attributes.background: To give dads a fair chance seeing there young ones without a court order, I speak for many dads who want involvment and to be active in there child’s upbringing and continue the supporting role in the wellbeing and the desires of the child, without false claims from the other party.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

If you would like a presumption of  joint custody, you could start a petition about that.

You may wish to sign the following petition:

Review and reform child custody arrangements
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/711426
